Hi Vincent,

On 9/26/05, Vincent D Murphy <vdm@...> wrote:
> On Mon, 26 =
Sep 2005 14:57:39 -0500, "Hugh Winkler" <hughw@...>
> said:
> > [hvw]=
 The point being I had to discover the nested url
> > https://yurl.net/id/p=
uqjiq25fjqre67paoc7omi3iynbdw62. Nothing prevents me
> > from posting that =
URL on some web page, or sending it in an email to my
> > friends, right? S=
o once you have shown me an URL, anyone I choose to send
> > it
> > to has =
access too?
>
> This is by design. You can grant a capability to somebody
>=
 by copying it. This is close to real-life keys; if I give
> you the key to=
 my house, you can use it even though its not
> your house.
>
> (Right, Tyl=
er?)

That's a good analogy.

Tyler
